revised_title: Investigating the Electrical Conductivity and Properties of Sodium Hydroxide Solutions
tldr: This article investigates the electrical conductivity and other properties of sodium hydroxide in aqueous solutions. The authors found that the conductivity-temperature curves can be represented by a formula that accounts for concentration, ionization, and ionic mobility. They also discovered that the intrinsic conductivity of the solution reaches a minimum at a certain concentration and then increases. The study provides insights into the behavior of electrolytes in solutions and the influence of temperature on their properties.
